title: Copy of Material Handler II, 1st shift, 9:30a-6p
description:
**WHY DO WE NEED YOU?**  

Saint-Gobain, a global top employer, is looking for **2** **Material Handlers** in theWayne, NJ Plant.



9:30am - 6pm; Monday - Friday



9am - 5:30pm; Monday - Friday



Scope: Maintain inventory of all assigned product. Pick, pack, and prepare product and necessary documentation for shipment, as specified by SOPs and work instructions.



Responsibilities:


* Unload/receive products, materials, and supplies from trucks according to SOPs, work instructions, and/or direction from the supervisor.
* Place finished product into inventory or ship to customer according to instructions on sales order paperwork.
* Perform weekly cycle counts and verify counts when directed by supervisor.
* Verify counts and proper part numbers and enter into computer system.
* Maintain first-in, first-out inventory rotation practice.
* Participate in physical inventory counts, according to SOP’s and as directed by supervisor.
* Communicate and cooperate with fellow employees to maintain quality, operational efficiency, and safety.
* Generate receipt travelers from computer system and verify accuracy of information.
* File sales orders, copies of shipping memos, UPS daily log, and bills of lading.
* Clean and maintain machinery, tools, and work area as scheduled or as needed.
* Maintain necessary records as required by SOP’s and work instructions.
* Visually observe, troubleshoot, and report non-conformance condition (either product or process) to supervisor, or manager as required.
* Participate in self-development and training of others.
* Perform other related duties as required or as directed by supervisor.
* Exhibits safety awareness and safe work practices.
* Understand all environmental policies and significant environmental impact of job activities in accordance with the ISO 14001 standard.

  

**WHAT ARE THE REQUIREMENTS?**  

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Able to operate independently and as a part of a team.
* Basic command of the English language, written and verbal.
* Able to read and follow SOPs, labels, and instructions.
* Mathematical abilities necessary to fulfil requirements of position.
* able to be trained as a Saint-Gobain “Certified” forklift operator.
* Proficient in department specific machines.
* Able to handle heavy, bulky items manually.
* Knowledge of area specific Saint-Gobain products.

  

**A TEAM READY TO WELCOME YOU**  

Saint-Gobain’s innovations touch almost every major industry around the world, moving us forward, making meaningful connections, and inspiring us to go beyond the impossible. Within Mobility, our teams design and engineer critical, high-performance materials and proven solutions – most in challenging conditions and core systems that play an important part of our daily lives – as we drive to work or with family, fly on an airplane to explore the world, process samples for medical research, build a better rocket to go as far as we can in outer space; and dive deep under the sea to power our world. We are driven to collaborate with our customers and communities to improve and engineer the world of tomorrow!



Our team members recognize that we all create the environment for people to succeed, with a culture built on respect, open and honest communication, and honoring our commitments to our customers and each other. And at the heart of our culture, we’ve learned working together makes good ideas, great ones.



With a legacy dating back more than 350 years, Saint-Gobain offers employees the stability and security of a leading Global 500 corporation while operating like multiple small and agile start-ups, where entrepreneurial spirit, pioneering teamwork, and bold, forward-thinking ideas pave new paths.



Every team member is encouraged to develop and leverage their unique expertise and strengths to make the greatest impact on the company and our end users. At Saint-Gobain, you’re empowered and equipped with countless opportunities and resources for professional development. You will find the support you need to create a vision and roadmap for your career, and make that vision a reality.


**Invent yourself at Saint-Gobain Mobility, and together, we’ll achieve the impossible!**

  



  

**Legal Statement**  

Saint-Gobain provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. Saint-Gobain is an equal opportunity employer of individuals with disabilities and supports the hiring of veterans.

 **STEPS TO JOIN US**  

We have a robust benefit program which includes:


* Medical/Pharmacy/Vision
* Dental
* Flexible Spending Accounts
* Life, Disability, Group Legal
* 401k
* Pension
* Tuition Reimbursement
* and much more

  


Job Reference: USA09815
company_description: Leader mondial de la construction légère & durable, Saint-Gobain conçoit, produit et distribue des matériaux et services pour les marchés de l’habitat et de l’industrie.

title: PESP Crisis Support Specialist
description:
Looking for a Full-Time Crisis Support Specialist for our Psychiatric Emergency Screening Program located at Bergen New Bridge Medical Center. The schedule is 9am-5pm Monday-Friday but may be flexible to meet program needs and include some weekends. This is a union position offering a competitive benefits package.

  

**Job Summary:**  

You will follow up outreach and/or on-site support services, care coordination, and psychoeducation to individuals who present to the Designated Screening Center and/or emergency rooms in Bergen County with high rates of recidivism. You will act as a liaison between the identified individuals and their family/support systems, treatment providers and relevant community resources to reduce the need for screening center and emergency room services.

  

**What You Will Do:**


* Follow up with individuals at risk via telephone, in-person, or virtually
* Provide supportive counseling, referral and/or linkage for individuals and support systems
* Monitoring and coordination of care for individuals at Bergen County hospitals
* Advocacy, Education, WRAP Planning, Psychiatric Advanced Directives
* Provide psycho-education as appropriate
* Provide follow up at hospitals upon admission and/or discharge
* Collaborate with treatment providers to coordinate care
* Ensure compliance with outlined goals of grant

  

**What We Need to See:**


* BA/BS degree in mental health and be interested in working with adults with mental illness, with 2 years' experience working in the field.
* Strong motivation to learn and work toward meeting the needs of the Bergen County community.
* Work well independently and within multidisciplinary teams, as well as collaboratively with law enforcement in the community, when appropriate.
* Valid NJ Driver's license and eligible to be insured under CPNJ automobile insurance policy.

  

**What We Offer:**


* Health, Dental and Vision
* Life & AD&D insurance; STD & LTD coverage
* Generous Paid Time Off
* Competitive Hourly Wages and Premium Holiday Compensation
* 401k Plan and Tuition Reimbursement
* Employee Discount and Rewards Program

  

**About CarePlus New Jersey:**


*CPNJ embraces a culture of diversity and inclusion in all of it policies and procedures. Care Plus follows Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, et seq and NJ Law Against Discrimination.* *We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by Federal and State laws.*

title: Program Director of Adoption House Union
description:
**Organizational Overview:** CarePlus New Jersey continues to be a leader in mental health and a pioneer in integrated care in Northern New Jersey for more than 45 years. CarePlus strives for excellence in mental health, addiction recovery, and community-based services. Our goal is to offer affordable, accessible, and holistic-centered care that empowers individuals to reach their full potential and enhance their quality of life.  

  

**Job Summary:**You will provide leadership, supervision, direction, and coordination of staff to ensure full provision of clinically sound services. Additionally, you will ensure departmental goals and/or objectives are accomplished within prescribed time frame by performing the job responsibilities personally or through subordinate staff.
  

  

**What You Will Do:****Supervisory Responsibilities**

* Direct, and oversee staff to ensure they achieve their personal as well as departmental goals
* Provide direct supervision to assigned staff in order to enhance their skill set, leadership qualities, and administrative functions
* Provide on-going support to staff to assure completion of job responsibilities
* Carry out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the Agency's policies, applicable laws and governmental regulatory agencies
* Ensure that documentation is compliant with all applicable standards (e.g. Federal, State, JCAHO, Agency internal policies and procedures, etc.)
* Review staff responsibilities to determine time frame and scope of authority, review staffing requirements, and allotments of available resources
* Confer with staff to provide technical advice and to resolve problems



**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**


* Serve as the team lead in completing intake/assessments and service plan
* Provide individual, family and group counseling services
* Facilitate psycho-educational groups for consumers on a variety of topics relating to wellness and recovery
* Offer on-site as well as outreach services (including transport of consumers)
* Fulfill case management services, including, but not limited to direct linkages to services, service coordination, treatment enrollment assistance, and so forth
* Communicate observations and information about the consumer in the consumer's service record and to team members
* Engage in supportive counseling
* Assess/evaluate consumers at intake/admissions, during ongoing recovery/service delivery and at discharge


**What We Need to See:**


* Master's Degree in social work or related field from an accredited college or university and experience providing clinical services to adults with serious and persistent mental illness.
* A minimum of three years program management, administrative and supervisory experience
* Valid Professional Licensure and/or Certification as required by program regulations & standards (LPC, LCSW).
* Valid driver's license and must be insurable by agency's automobile insurance for primary drivers


**What We Offer:**


* Health, Dental and Vision
* Life & AD&D insurance; STD & LTD coverage
* Generous Paid Time Off
* Competitive Salary and Premium Holiday Compensation
* 403B Plan and Tuition Reimbursement
* Employee Discount and Rewards Program


**About CarePlus New Jersey:**

title: Families First Counselor
description:
**Organizational Overview:**  

CarePlus New Jersey continues to be a leader in mental health and a pioneer in integrated care in Northern New Jersey for more than 45 years. The CarePlus Foundation was created over 25 years ago to support further the programs and clients of CarePlus who strive to achieve mental well-being and overall wellness. CarePlus strives for excellence in mental health, addiction recovery, and community-based services. Our goal is to offer affordable, accessible, and holistic-centered care that empowers individuals to reach their full potential and enhance their quality of life.

  

**Job Summary:**


* Provides in-home services and supportive interventions including, case management, linkage to community resources, and inter-agency coordination of treatment.
* Conduct assessments and evaluations of clients at intake, during ongoing service, delivery, and termination
* Formulate relevant goals with behaviorally measurable objectives that serve as indices for evaluating intervention progress and realistic time frames for achievement.
* Prepare written documentation of assessments, interception plans, progress notes, and discharge summaries in the clients' files with all entries authenticated with dates and times.
* Plan for, communicate, and document aftercare plans for clients completing program and/or accessing other services in the continuum.
* Collaborate as a member of an interdisciplinary team, including but not limited to, active participation in program and team meetings, providing support to team colleagues, and engaging in program-related performance improvement processes and activities.
* Participate in weekly team case conferences and trainings as per Family Preservation Services' requirements.
* Provide 24/7 coverage to caseload


**What We Need to See:**


* A Bachelor's degree or a master's degree in social work or other behavioral health discipline from an accredited college or university.
* Two (2) years of experience providing counseling to children and families.
* Bilingual (Spanish), preferred.
* A valid driver's license must be insurable by the agency's automobile insurance.

  

**What We Offer:**


* 401K
* High plan insurance at a generous cost
* Union benefits
* Life & AD&D insurance; STD & LTD coverage
* Per diem opportunities
* Excellent supervision and training
* Continuing education, tuition reimbursement and eligibility for loan forgiveness
* 10% daycare discount

  

**About CarePlus New Jersey:**

title: Director of Production Management & Operations
description:
**Summary**
-----------



BSE Global ("BSE") is a multifaceted sports and entertainment business that brings people together to experience music, sports, and culture through our teams and venue. BSE is developing a modern media company that champions the spirit and attitude of Brooklyn and amplifies it to the world. Rooted in digital storytelling across all channels and formats, we will cultivate a highly-engaged global audience by reaffirming the connective threads that tie sports, music, fashion and sneakers, and food not just to Brooklyn geographically, but in how they're embedded into its DNA.



We are assembling a team of agile, culturally proficient, entrepreneurial-minded talent who will craft the vision strategy and tactics to bring this initiative to life. We believe that our team should mirror the diversity of the Brooklyn communities that have shaped culture, so we can create content that authentically reflects and resonates beyond the borough's borders.



BSE is seeking a dynamic and experienced Director of Production Management & Operations to oversee and optimize the efficiency of our production processes. This role is integral to ensuring the seamless execution of projects, from initial conception through to final delivery. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in production management and operations, coupled with proven leadership abilities.


**Job description – what you will do:**
---------------------------------------


* Be responsible for all aspects of production processes, including scheduling, budgeting, resource allocation, and logistics.
* Develop and implement strategic plans for production operations aligned with company goals and objectives.
* Provide leadership and guidance to production managers, coordinators, and other team members to ensure cohesive and efficient workflow.
* Collaborate with creative and technical teams to plan and execute production schedules that meet quality standards and deadlines.
* Manage production budgets, monitor expenditures, and optimize resource allocation to enhance efficiency and minimize costs.
* Negotiate contracts with vendors, suppliers, and service providers to ensure cost-effective solutions without compromising quality.
* Implement quality control measures to uphold production and post-production standards and ensure adherence to industry regulations and company policies.
* Continuously evaluate production workflows and processes to identify areas for improvement and implement standard processes.
* Identify potential risks and proactively develop contingency plans to mitigate disruptions to production schedules or operations.
* Resolve production-related issues and challenges in a timely and effective manner, fostering a culture of problem-solving and innovation.
* Recruit, train, and mentor production staff to cultivate an impactful team capable of achieving production goals.
* Stay abreast of industry trends, technological advancements, and standard processes.
* Leverage technology and innovation to streamline workflows, improve productivity, and enhance the overall production process.

**Candidate profile – who you are:**
------------------------------------


* Proven experience (typically 5+ years) in production management, operations management, and related roles within the entertainment, media, or creative industries.
* Proficiency in production management software, budgeting tools, and other relevant technologies.
* Strong leadership abilities with demonstrated experience in managing and developing teams.
* Exceptional organizational and multitasking skills, with the ability to prioritize and handle multiple projects simultaneously.
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across departments and stakeholders.
* Strategic thinker with a track record of implementing process improvements and achieving operational efficiencies.

**Travel requirements**
-----------------------



May be required to travel on occasions; trips may require air travel and/or overnight stay for one or more nights.


**Salary range**
----------------



$120,000-$150,000


**Work environment**
--------------------



Works primarily in an office environment but upon request will be encouraged to attend games and other events on evenings, weekends and holidays.



We are an Equal Employment Opportunity ("EEO") Employer. It has been and will continue to be a fundamental policy of the Company not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, gender, gender identity, transgender status, pregnancy, marital status, partnership status, domestic violence victim status, sexual orientation, age, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, veteran or military status, disability, genetic information or any other characteristic prohibited by federal, state or local laws.

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
Launch your career! We are hiring immediately for Warehouse workers! We will teach you about distribution and supply chain techniques valued by Fortune 250 companies around the globe. We are Wesco! We enable the connected world – you help turn on the lights.


**Shift:** Monday through Friday; 11:00 a.m. - 8:00 p.m.


**Why You’ll Love Wesco**

When you join Wesco, you become part of a global leader in business-to-business distribution, logistics services and supply chain management solutions. With our best-in-class product and services portfolio and our massive scale, there are endless opportunities for you to build your career with us.


**A Day in The Life of a Warehouse Associate**

As a Warehouse Associate you will be responsible for performing warehouse tasks including receiving, picking, packing, shipping, wire cutting, light assembly, as well as general maintenance of assigned areas.


* Complete log sheets and handle inbound shipments
* Verify supplier returns and enter order receipts
* Relocate and consolidate material
* Prepare and assemble packing lists
* Pack, label, wrap, and load outbound trucks
**What’s in it for You**

* Wesco is not just a job, but a company where you can learn, develop, and build your career! In addition to training and development opportunities we offer educational assistance so you can pursue your passions
* A benefits package designed with your total well-being in mind including generous paid time off, comprehensive insurance options for you and your family, 401k, and more
* National discounts on commonly used items (computers, appliances, services, etc.)
* Benefits may vary by location and union environment
**Education & Experience**

* High school degree or equivalent preferred
* No experience required/ entry level
* 1 year of warehouse operations experience preferred
**Skills & Requirements**

* Basic computer skills preferred
* Basic problem-solving skills
* Ability to lift up to 50 pounds
* Ability to be on your feet for extended periods
* Willingness to operate warehouse equipment, including power equipment
**Are You Ready to Launch Your Career with Wesco?**

Founded in 1922, Wesco has grown and transformed into an industry-leading Fortune 250 supply chain solutions company. Join us as we build, connect, power, and protect the world.


**https://www.Wesco.com/careers**

*Wesco International, Inc., including its subsidiaries and affiliates (“Wesco”) provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, religion, color, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, or other characteristics protected by law. US applicants only, we are an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.*


  
Compensation Details $18.24 - $21.89 per hour
  
The compensation amount is not guaranteed. This amount is what we reasonably believe we will pay for the position, however, offer amounts may vary based on factors such as geographic location, experience and qualifications.  

  

Wesco provides a variety of benefits to employees. More information about benefits is available here . For eligible positions, compensation may also include participation in an incentive plan.
  
At Wesco, we build, connect, power and protect the world. As a leading provider of business-to-business distribution, logistics services and supply chain solutions, we create a world that you can depend on.
Our company’s greatest asset is our people. Wesco is committed to fostering diversity and inclusion across our workforce by embracing the unique perspectives, authenticity and individuality of more than 20,000 Wesco employees around the globe. Through our Business Resource Groups , comprehensive benefits plan and our community outreach initiatives, you can be a part of a welcoming work community who provides platforms for your success.
Learn more about Working at Wesco here and apply online today!
Founded in 1922 and headquartered in Pittsburgh, Wesco is a publicly traded (NYSE: WCC) FORTUNE 500® company.

title: Veterinary Receptionist
description:
**Seeking an independent and compassionate Receptionist to join our team!**


**Why Levittown Animal Hospital in Levittown, NY?**  

We have a strong focus on culture and team satisfaction, and we foster a collaborative environment where all team members have a say in the decisions we make. Our team is diverse and inclusive; All are welcome!



We are looking for team members that are trustworthy and compassionate with a strong work ethic and are looking to strengthen the human animal bond.



Our mission is to offer the best health care options for our patients in a compassionate, friendly, and caring environment. With appropriate client education, we empower our clients to make informed decisions regarding their companion's health care.



Our goal for our clients is to provide gold standard care along with an outstanding experience.


**What makes us different from other hospitals?**  

No boarding, no over-nights, no on-call duties. We promote open communication and encourage feedback on all levels of the organization to deliver the best work experience possible. Our goal for our team is to provide support in every way possible, while still be able to enjoy coming to work!



We are the first hospital on LI to become Low Stress Handling certified. We take great pride in making visits as stress-free as possible for our patients. We are also AAHA accredited and will continue to maintain that level of medical and surgical standards.


**We believe that job satisfaction and work-life balance are important:**  

We have a 4-day work week, generous discounts for your pet's health care, and competitive compensation packages with benefits.


**Best of Long Island:**  

We were voted as the Best Pet Hospital and Best Veterinarian (Dr. Michael Funk, DVM) in Bethpage's Best of Long Island. We are extremely honored that our clients and community recognize the outstanding care our hospital provides.


**Requirements:**  

The ideal candidate will have experience as a patient care coordinator in the veterinary field and be able to work a weekend day.


**Who are we looking for?**  

Applicants must have a professional work ethic, positive personality, ability to multi-task, and have a passion for delivering exceptional care to patients.



Our Veterinary Receptionists are the faces and voices of Levittown Animal Hospital. They are truly ambassadors for the standards of care we strive to provide and thus, must always behave professionally and with compassion, sympathy, and empathy. Receptionists must be friendly, courteous, and capable of handling multiple tasks at once in a fast-paced environment.


**Schedule:**  

This is a full-time need working 30-35 hours/week. Monday-Wednesday, Saturday


**Responsibilities can include but are not limited to:**


* Greet clients and their pets and complete the appointment sign in process which can include: inputting and retrieving information from our practice management software, confirming the reason for the appointment, receiving and confirming the client's contact information, letting the medical team know the patient has arrived and escort the client to the exam room with their pet.
* Assist clients with check-out including, but not limited to ensuring services and product sales are correctly accounted, using the practice management software system, handling money, processing credit and debit cards, accepting and recording various forms of payment, and creating future appointments for follow-up visits.
* Answer phone calls from clients requesting appointments, asking questions about the hospital, requesting medication refills and call into pharmacy if needed as authorized by a veterinarian.
* Scheduling appointments for surgery, sick and well visits, ultrasounds, and more.
* Understand common vaccination protocols, basic lab tests, common diseases, veterinary terminology, and pet behavior.
* Assist in cleanliness and maintenance of the hospital to ensure a great client experience.


**Benefits:**  

We're dedicated to your well-being and offer a comprehensive package and professional development opportunities to support your work and home life. These include:


* Competitive salary: $17-$19/hr. based on experience and skill set!
* Medical, dental, vision, and prescription drug benefits for you and eligible dependents
* Paid time off for full-time employees
* 401(k) plan
* Continuing education allowance for licensed technicians
* Guardian voluntary benefits
* Community Outreach Day
company_description: Levittown Animal Hospital is an award-winning facility providing dogs and cats with superb veterinary services and gentle bedside manner.

title: Respite Worker - Arverne, Queens
description:
Location: Arverne, Queens, NY  

Pay Rate: $16.00  

Hours: 10 hours per week

 **JOB DESCRIPTION:**


Respite is utilized by placing staff that provide supervision to ensure the safety of the individual while allowing the primary caregiver time away from the day-to-day care of their loved one.  

  

Respite Workers perform a wide variety of person centered supports and services with a strong emphasis on personal choice to individuals with developmental disabilities  

  

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**  

The duties and responsibilities of the Respite Worker include, but are not limited to the following:

* Provide services to persons served in their home and community.
* Perform lifting and other one-to-one functions for the individuals we serve.
* Perform direct care work that involves skill building services.
* Monitor the safety and welfare of people served, take corrective actions as necessary and immediately notify supervisor of concerns.
* Assist and support people served to build positive relationships in their community.
* Provide needed support and encouragement for people served to advocate for their needs and rights.
* Communicate health care concerns to supervisor or administrator as necessary.
* Communicate professionally with persons receiving services, families, team members and the community.
* Encourage community integration with an emphasis on inclusion, access, community awareness and safety.
* Attend staff meetings and participate in supervision for professional growth and development.
* Complete all required initial and annual training as well as ongoing training to increase knowledge.
* Conduct fire drills, where applicable, and document results in accordance with supervisor’s instructions.
* Report to work promptly and adhere to the assigned schedule.
* Adhere to and implement the NADSP Code of Ethics, Justice Center Code of Conduct and NYS DSP Core Competencies.
* Adhere to all Agency and Program Policies and Procedures, including HIPAA, Confidentiality and implementing the Corporate Compliance Plan and related policies and procedures.
* Other related duties as assigned.

 **KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS and ABILITIES:**

* Ability to instruct others on vocational or daily living skills.
* Actively listen and be able to communicate, verbally and in writing.
* Ability to work as part of an interdisciplinary team.
* Good interpersonal skills and commitment to assisting individuals with disabilities.
* Maintain composure under pressure.
* Ability to speak, read and write in English.
* Serve as a role model and represent the agency positively in the community.
* Ability to use a computer or mobile device to access email and required software.
* Ability to self-initiate projects and function autonomously as a leader when needed.

  

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

*To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.*

* Good oral and written communication skills.
* Ability to read, write, speak, and understand English.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality.
* Strong interpersonal, listening, communication and motivational skills.
* Good analytical ability with problem-solving and follow up.
* Ability to work independently and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Proficiency in the use of a personal computer and appropriate software and E-Mail system.
* Valid driver’s license and the ability to operate an agency vehicle if needed.


**EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE**

* High School Diploma or GED

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS**
====================

* Ability to perform the essential physical functions of the job including but not limited to the ability to stoop, lift, kneel, push, pull, reach, stand, walk, hear, listen and communicate appropriately.

  

  

**WORK ENVIRONMENT**

*The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.*

* Program and community-based environments.

  

New York Families for Autistic Children is an Equal Opportunity Employer. New York Families for Autistic Children does not discriminate due to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender and/or gender identity or expression, marital or parental status, national origin, ethnicity, citizenship status, veteran or military status, age, disability, unemployment status or any other legally protected basis, and to the extent permitted by law. Qualified candidates of diverse ethnic and racial backgrounds are encouraged to apply for vacant positions at all levels.

title: Account Supervisor
description:
**Intro:**
Reset your expectations of a health and wellness agency. Independent by design and built on a foundation of empathy, Fingerpaint celebrates what you bring as both a professional and an individual. With talent across the United States and Europe launching more than 200 brands, we are committed to creating and executing meaningful experiences. Here, creativity happens naturally—we attract top talent and give them a space to grow and collaborate.
  

**Objectives of This Role:**

This role requires extreme attention to detail and strong organizational skills. You’ll be responsible for providing leadership in account management, including day-to-day account activities and strategic guidance to clients. You must have a solid understanding of all things digital. We’ll require you to work with other agency account leaders to facilitate optimal client service and a quality experience. This role will increasingly be involved in the strategic direction of a single brand, while mentoring and encouraging junior staff. People both inside and outside the agency look to the account supervisor to get the job done.  

  

**Duties and Responsibilities:*** Ability to think strategically, creatively, and collaboratively
* Excellent understanding of the digital marketplace and ad formats
* Highly effective communication skills
* Ability to effectively work with multiple team members
* Management of junior staff
* Demonstrate solid presentation skills
* Maintain strong and solid client relationships, elevating any issues to senior management
* Foster a collaborative environment on the account, working closely with all departments.
* Key day-to-day client-facing member of the account team
* Take responsibility for development of projects
* Responsible for understanding all tools/processes necessary for a well-running account (workflow process, creative briefs, financial management, etc)
* Assist in SOW development; able to draft SOW with direction (descriptions, tactics, budgets, and timelines) while collaborating with management
* Collaborate with project management team to manage project budgets and provide financial tracking
* Support the account team in brand plan development, engaging appropriate team members accordingly
* Understand all the tactics for the brand and identify any additional gaps in marketing tactics
* Support the account team and participate at workshops and brainstorming meetings internally and with the client
* Communicate strategy and tactical plans effectively across the team
* Develop strategic and actionable project briefs and project palates
* Actively monitor the headlines for current brand and competitor news, trends, and white space opportunity



**Job Requirements:*** 4 to 7 years of pharmaceutical advertising agency experience
* Demonstrate strong written and verbal skills
* Media experience is a plus
* Bachelor’s degree
* Familiarity with pharmaceutical medical, legal, regulatory (MLR) review process and systems
* Understand FDA rules/regulations and life cycle of a brand
* Active client service management, working directly with clients and executing projects
* Strong multitasker: ability to run multiple projects, priorities, and client demands
* Solid grasp of brand operations: understanding the nuts and bolts of the account (brand style guide, PRC process, key data, etc)
* Solid understanding of Veeva systems and client requirements
* Understand industry trends and guidelines (eg, CAN-SPAM, privacy policy, etc)
* Understand brand fundamentals (positioning, messaging, creative concept) and how they all work together
* Understand market research methodology and approaches
* Understand brand’s/account’s key customers
* Understand competitors and advocacy groups for each account/brand
* Understand the role and use of analytics
* Understand the core strategic elements of the development of a multichannel strategy
* Understand capabilities within the media group and Shift
* Ability to travel to clients in NJ and to the NJ 1-2 times/month

title: Director, Engagement Strategy
description:
Reset your expectations of a health and wellness agency. Independent by design and built on a foundation of empathy, Fingerpaint celebrates what you bring as both a professional and an individual. With talent across the United States and Europe launching more than 200 brands, we are committed to creating and executing meaningful experiences. Here, creativity happens naturally—we attract top talent and give them a space to grow and collaborate.


  

Objectives of This Role:


We’re looking for a director, engagement strategy who is ready to help shake up the status quo in healthcare marketing. The right individual will be comfortable understanding, shaping, and optimizing a brand’s multichannel footprint. This person will guide the brand team from concept to execution, including development of program briefs. You will begin to see the “big picture” of the brand-customer experience. You will partner with brand strategy groups to frame the customers’ behavior trends/patterns, identify differences across customer segments, and apply all learnings to their journey.


 Duties and Responsibilities:

* Work alongside account, strategy, and creative teams to ensure that digital and engagement strategies are properly integrated within the larger marketing programs
* Lead engagement workshops for tactical planning and pitches
* Communicate a vision to the client team on how the brand should engage, educate, interact, and/or collaborate with their customers
* Direct the digital strategy team on the overall vision of the customers’ brand journey
* Guide the brand team from concept to execution, including development of program briefs
* Employ a variety of methods, including market trends/gap analysis, segmentation, personas, customer journeys, content mapping, program architecture, data capture strategies, scoring models, service training, and business process optimization
* Assist a VP/SVP to architect a thoughtful customer experience (CX) that delivers a positive relationship with the brand
* Partner with brand leads to identify strategic imperatives and their associated key performance indicator that all communications will be tied to
* Understand individual customers’ needs and those of healthcare portfolio holders
* Understand behaviors and the mechanisms by which a brand can be relevant to their users to drive acquisition, servicing, and loyalty
* Bring together creativity and data to create compelling personal experiences that grow our clients’ business
* Assess campaign and program performance, optimizing and applying learnings to future initiatives
* Analyze available data and apply thoughtfully across the brand to drive or support agency points of view
* Provide clients with innovative strategies that span digital, social, mobile, and traditional media

 Job Requirements:

* Minimum of 7 years of digital marketing or project experience (within a pharmaceutical agency strongly desired)
* Proficient in Microsoft Office
* Familiarity and comfort interacting with Google Analytics
* Strong background in data management
* Demonstrate expertise in SEMRush
* Understanding of user experience principles
* Practical experience and strong knowledge of integrated marketing disciplines:
	+ SEO/SEM best practices
	+ CRM experience
	+ Direct marketing
	+ Knowledge of UI design principles
	+ Content strategy

title: VP, Brand Strategy
description:
**Intro:**
Reset your expectations of a health and wellness agency. Independent by design and built on a foundation of empathy, Fingerpaint celebrates what you bring as both a professional and an individual. With talent across the United States and Europe launching more than 200 brands, we are committed to creating and executing meaningful experiences. Here, creativity happens naturally—we attract top talent and give them a space to grow and collaborate.
  

**Objectives of This Role:**
We’re looking for a big-idea, original-thinker brand strategist who can encourage clients (and internal account and creative teams) to improve strategic outputs, question assumptions, and reshape assignments into category-challenging propositions to create unique brand experiences. We’re seeking someone who can act as a catalyst to move brands forward and devise innovative ways to engage customers.
In this position you will lead and contribute to new business and ongoing strategic client engagements, developing a deep understanding of the client’s business environment, competitive landscape, brand goals, vision, and strategy. You will regularly lead the charge to identify compelling insights, customer needs, and market opportunities that create a competitive advantage and help drive business for our clients.
**Duties and Responsibilities:*** Leverage a deep understanding of brand marketing to collaborate on the successful building of effective, innovative brand strategies across multiple channels
* Initiate brand strategy discussions and subsequent market research initiatives to identify market needs and create and exploit brand opportunities
* Have a strong passion for people and the desire to uncover key customer/market insights as the basis for strategies and communication, which change perceptions and influence behavior to create a competitive advantage
* Have the ability (and desire) to think big across a wide range of strategic opportunities, from launch planning to the evolution of long-standing platforms
* Collaborate with multidisciplinary team members in the development and presentation of integrated, innovative, strategic marketing solutions
* Define key performance indicators to support brand strategy and objectives, conduct analysis to determine program ROI, help create and inform metric reports and dashboards, and make recommendations based on learnings
* Create dynamic and compelling presentations that deliver new thinking, bring audiences along for your ride, and create “yes, and” moments
* Ability to produce clear and concise written documents (proposals, strategic rationales, point-of-view statements, case studies, discussion guides, etc)
* Follow trends and innovations to impact integrated communication strategies (eg, media, digital, research, etc)
* Provide thought leadership/oversight in matters of research design, stimuli development, research reporting, customer/competitor/market audits, and traditional strategic deliverables (eg, brand positioning, annual brand planning)
* Responsible for leading and developing a team of strategists
* Work with account lead to expand agency role, presence, and contribution
* Identify opportunities to expand the strategic remit and develop/sell in additional strategy deliverables and workshops
* Lead development of the pitch story flow and strategy deliverables and ensure integration with creative deliverables
* Lead team ideation sessions and lead the development and moderation; oversee the reporting of strategy workshops
* Partner with other strategy disciplines throughout client engagements
* Partner with third-party resources/partners and other client agency teams
* Proactively engage in internal strategic dialogue to share information and inform agency response
* Support department lead in setting the tone and direction of the strategic offering


**Know-how:*** Entrepreneurial “can do” attitude and a relentless passion for collaboration and innovation
* Demonstrated expertise for uncovering insights and leveraging them to achieve marketing objectives
* The ability to translate clients’ goals and objectives into actionable and measurable marketing recommendations
* Knowledge of marketing/advertising mix (interactive, sales support, traditional, broadcast, experiential, events, etc)


**Job Requirements:*** Bachelor’s degree required. Graduate degree preferred in behavioral sciences, business marketing, and/or advertising
* Must have 8+ years of brand strategy experience, delivering custom marketing solutions within a digital marketing, consulting, and/or advertising agency environment
* Experience in the pharmaceutical and/or medical/healthcare industry is a plus
* Oncology experience preferred
* Ability to travel to clients & office in New Jersey, periodically

title: Submission Specialist
description:
The Submissions Specialist is responsible for ensuring consistent and accurate regulatory submissions for Fingerpaint Marketing clients. The specialist is immersed in the weekly workflow for assigned brand teams and owns all submissions-related activities for brand projects, inclusive of prework, submission-day tasks, and resubmissions.  

**Duties and Responsibilities**  

The specialist is expected to:
* Know all brand submission requirements; attend and complete any required brand-specific training and credentialing need to service client work
* Partner with copy, project management, scientific strategy, editorial, and account team members for submission-day success
* Tag, link, and upload submission files and support materials, including references, in Veeva Vault and other client-specific systems; apply functional annotations as needed
* Follow and maintain the submissions calendar and attend weekly internal brand team standup meetings to stay informed of deadlines
* Maintain reference library for assigned brands; upload and retrieve references as needed
* Serve as a general advocate for submissions excellence and support the growth and refinement of the submissions team, workflow, and processes

 **Job Requirements**  

* Bachelor’s degree
* 1 to 2 years of experience as a submissions specialist in the pharmaceutical marketing and advertising industry; prior experience at an agency or pharmaceutical company preferred
* Flexibility in schedule; able to accommodate submissions work for agency teams for East and West Coast hours
* Software/systems proficiency in Veeva Vault and other client submissions systems; Adobe Acrobat, Microsoft SharePoint (Word, Excel, PowerPoint); experience with Workfront and Airtable a plus; Mac user required
* Ability to understand and absorb scientific content
* Ability to work under pressure and multitask; strong attention to detail and accuracy

  

* Proactive, team player with strong interpersonal skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication, planning, critical thinking
* Exercises good judgment with procedures and policies to determine appropriate action

title: VP, Associate Creative Director, Art
description:
Reset your expectations of a health and wellness agency. Independent by design and built on a foundation of empathy, Fingerpaint celebrates what you bring as both a professional and an individual. With talent across the United States and Europe launching more than 200 brands, we are committed to creating and executing meaningful experiences. Here, creativity happens naturally—we attract top talent and give them a space to grow and collaborate.***This role is largely remote, however it will require being local to the Cedar Knolls, NJ office location.***
In this role you will be responsible for leading the creative work that is produced across a number of our accounts. This leadership role includes assigning teams, inspiring those teams to consistently produce exceptional concepts and final work, and working closely with account management to ensure that our clients are satisfied with the quality of our creative work, the value of our services, and our responsiveness to their needs.**What it takes:*** Ability to work collaboratively with other capabilities such as account management, project management, and more
* Manage workloads to maximize productivity of the art team, ensuring that everyone is busy and billable
* Help develop and review creative briefs that provide strategic insight and creative inspiration
* Work with ACD, Copy to produce standout and strategically focused concepts and campaigns
* Manage and work independently, under tight deadlines, while juggling multiple projects
* Estimate copy hours
* Participate in client meetings
* Lead concept presentations
* Provide written and face-to-face feedback for annual performance reviews, as well as ongoing feedback throughout the year (written when requested)
* Identify and interview prospective creative candidates
* Lead the creative teams in development of concepts and execution of all projects
* Demonstrate to clients that you understand their products and marketing challenges and are responsive to the strategic and creative needs

title: VP, Scientific Strategy
description:
Reset your expectations of a health and wellness agency. Independent by design and built on a foundation of empathy, Fingerpaint celebrates what you bring as both a professional and an individual. With talent across the United States and Europe launching more than 200 brands, we are committed to creating and executing meaningful experiences. Here, creativity happens naturally—we attract top talent and give them a space to grow and collaborate.  

  

Objectives of This Role:

Are you hungry to help push the boundaries of what’s possible in medicine? Come join our team in translating the latest scientific discoveries into compelling brand strategies, provider education, and patient care. At Fingerpaint, we focus on infusing science into all aspects of a unified brand-building process to drive commercial and medical communication strategies. The VP, scientific strategy will need to utilize all of their capabilities as a scientist and a person, tapping into both their scientific thinking and creative core. Our ideal partner is a deep and dynamic thinker who can read beyond the data to create focused scientific concepts, push past observations to insights, and help guide our teams forward in strategic development. The VP, scientific strategy will have purview over a therapeutic category and a multilevel team while learning to train mentors, conceptualize/introduce novel business opportunities, and seamlessly move across all business to provide direction or support as needed.

Duties and Responsibilities:
* Partner across the disciplines of strategy to drive brand building, unbranded initiatives, and communication planning
* Foster authentic and effective relationships with client brand and medical teams, as well as other relevant medical personnel (eg, key opinion leaders, MSLs, etc)
* Manage and mentor scientific strategists in all aspects of career and personal development
* Elevate the quality or increase efficiency of existing projects and propose novel ideas for Fingerpaint services or deliverables
* Partner in annual scope development and review
* Champion the culture of Fingerpaint and scientific strategy
* Oversee a distinct book of business and team of medical strategists with the goals of ensuring the highest quality of all deliverables, expanding medical business, and overall organic growth
* Self-educate on innovation in the industry, therapeutic area, and medicine to conceptualize novel projects, programs, or platform
* Manage a team, overseeing workloads, diversity of assignments and experiences, and career development plan
* Lead new business opportunities (content and attendance)
* Develop a highly collaborative and agile working relationship with clients, providing proactive and reactive strategic consultancy
* Ability to flex into each brand within the agency to define projects and process, run workshops or advisory boards, or manage difficult projects/conversations
* Enable collaboration and cross-selling across the offices of Fingerpaint
* Identify novel resources to elevate the knowledge base of our industry, driving more strategic, informed work across all brands

Job Requirements:
* Relevant degree (PhD preferred)
* Experience with oncology is required.
* Minimum of 7 to 10 years of experience in the pharmaceutical industry and/or pharmaceutical marketing
* Experience developing medical communications programs preferred
* Is effective in a variety of formal presentation settings—one-on-one, small/large groups, with peers, subordinates, and bosses—both inside and outside the organization
* Proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint, Word, and Adobe
* Constant curiosity with the passion to explore and create

title: Chemical Operator 1
description:
**ABOUT THE ORGANIZATION**

  

Sun Chemical, a member of the DIC Group, is a leading producer of packaging and graphic solutions, color and display technologies, functional products, electronic materials, and products for the automotive and healthcare industries. Together with DIC, Sun Chemical is continuously working to promote and develop sustainable solutions to exceed customer expectations and better the world around us. With combined annual sales of more than $8.5 billion and 22,000+ employees worldwide, the DIC Group companies support a diverse collection of global customers.

  

Sun Chemical Corporation is a subsidiary of Sun Chemical Group Coöperatief U.A., the Netherlands, and is headquartered in Parsippany, New Jersey, U.S.A. For more information, please visit our website at www.sunchemical.com or connect with us on LinkedIn or Twitter

 **Job Title: Chemical Operator**

**Location: Peekskill, NY**

**Day & Night Shift Available (7-7)**

**Hourly Rate: $27.39 to $28.97**

 **Description:**


The Peekskill, NY Pigment manufacturing site is seeking candidates for the position of Chemical Operator. Position is responsible for mixing/blending of materials, operation of process equipment, material handling, instrument monitoring, record keeping, and forklift operation. Must follow all safety procedures and act in a safe manner at all times.

 **Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
* Efficiently operate equipment: adding materials at designated times and observing chemical reactions; monitor gauges, samples and recorders to ensure timely completion of quality batches per production schedule.
* Adjust controls and valves to maintain systems at specified temperature, pressure and speed.
* Maintain housekeeping at excellent levels, keeping the tanks, floor and reactor deck areas clean.
* Required to operate a forklift in a safe manner.
* Wear necessary safety equipment and follow company established Safety, Health and Environmental policies and procedures.

 **Qualifications:**

* HS diploma or equivalent.
* Possess intermediate computer skills (Use computerized process system, Internet, email, etc.)
* An understanding and awareness of chemicals and their nature, hazards, safety and health issues etc. (SDS's, use of PPE etc.) is beneficial
* Physical strength is required to operate manual process equipment. Must meet lifting requirements (55 lbs.) and pass physical requirements.
* Must demonstrate ability to be self-directed working with minimal supervision

 **Plus:**

* Experience in a chemical plant or manufacturing environment is a plus.

**BENEFITS**  

  

We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k)+match and life insurance. Eligibility of benefit timing may vary.

 **EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY**

  

It is Sun’s policy that applicants for employment are recruited, selected, and hired on the basis of individual merit and ability with respect to the position being filled. Sun prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identify, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other status protected by applicable law.


#ID23

 *Employment agencies are an important component of our talent acquisition strategy, and we value the partnerships we have built with our preferred vendors. We will not accept unsolicited resumes from employment agencies for any employment opportunity. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Sun Chemical or directly to hiring managers in any form without a signed contract on file, and search engagement for that position, will be deemed unsolicited in nature, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired as a result of the referral or through other means. Additionally, any resume submitted without a contract in place will be considered property of Sun Chemical and no fees will be paid to the agency if the candidate is hired.*

title: Part-Time Middle School After-School Counselor
description:
Job Title: Part-Time Middle School After-School Counselor  

Department: Hewitt After-School  

FLSA Status: Non-Exempt  

The Hewitt School - New York, NY  

  

ABOUT HEWITT  

  

Established in 1920 and located in New York City, The Hewitt School is an independent K-12 girls’ school whose mission is to inspire girls and young women to become game changers and ethical leaders who forge an equitable, sustainable, and joyous future. Hewitt empowers and expects our community members to embrace multiple points of view, to engage others with empathy and integrity, and to champion equity and justice in all areas of our lives. As a community, Hewitt is fully committed to a culturally diverse faculty, staff, and student body.  

  

POSITION SUMMARY
  

The part-time middle school after-school counselor will be responsible for providing a safe, nurturing, educational, and recreational-based environment at The Hewitt School. The counselor is expected to behave in a professional manner at all times, including dress and speech. The counselor is expected to treat all members of the Hewitt community with respect, understanding, and a sense of responsibility.  

  

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES
* Supervise middle school students enrolled in after-school from 3:00 to 6:00 pm while school is in session
* Create a productive learning environment and assist students with their homework as needed
* Communicate effectively and in a timely manner with parents, guardians, and caregivers about all aspects of after-school programming, including scheduling, special events, incidents, or accidents
* Dismiss students to authorized adults and keep an accurate record of the dismissal time and any changes
* Be responsible for attendance, dismissal, and program supervision
* Respond to emergencies in a calm and professional manner and communicate with all parties involved in a timely manner

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED
* Demonstrated commitment to anti-bias education and social justice
* Knowledge of and experience with supervising students in middle school and acting as a positive role model
* Reliable and dependable
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Knowledge of Google Suite (Gmail, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Slides)

QUALIFICATIONS DESIRED
* Bachelor’s degree
* Proficient with Mac platforms; comfortable with technology or demonstrated ability to learn quickly
* Investment in the social emotional learning and cognitive development of middle school students

SALARY RANGE
  

Starting Salary Range: $20.00 to $25.00 per hour (salary based upon, but not limited to, relevant experience and expertise)  

  

TO APPLY: Please submit a resumé, cover letter, and examples of previous relevant work via our applicant tracking portal. Cover letters should reflect a careful reading of The Hewitt School’s website, including the School’s academic philosophy. No phone calls, please. Recruitment will remain open until the position is filled; applicants should apply as soon as possible for consideration.  

  

IMPORTANT INFORMATION  

  

The Hewitt School is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It has been and will continue to be a fundamental policy of the School not to discriminate on the basis of any category prohibited by applicable federal, New York State and/or New York City laws/regulations. This policy applies to all aspects of the employment process, including hiring, promotion, demotion, compensation/benefits, performance evaluations, disciplinary actions, training, working conditions, layoff, and termination.

title: Service Technician- Roadside
description:
**Position Summary**
The Service Technician performs preventative maintenance, diagnoses, and makes advanced repairs at various remote/roadside locations. This position is responsible for ensuring company equipment is running at optimal performance. The Service Technician determines the causes of failure and implements strategies or corrective measures to ensure failures do not reoccur. This position is responsible for various activities, including but not limited to cleaning, maintaining, assembling, and reconditioning equipment.
**Duties and Responsibilities Include**
*Essential Duties:*
* Operates, inspects, troubleshoots, performs diagnostics, and identifies defects/malfunctions
* Determines required repairs on heavy and/or hydraulic equipment
* Repairs or overhauls mechanical, hydraulic, and pneumatic equipment
* Performs preventative equipment maintenance
* Documents and submits all necessary paperwork in an accurate and timely manner
* Maintains availability for after-hours service calls

* Two (2) or more years of heavy equipment mechanic experience

title: HR & Recruiting Coordinator
description:

Through leading edge R&D and manufacturing, PENTAX Medical provides endoscopic imaging devices and solutions to the global medical community.
**Position Opening:** HR & Recruiting Coordinator
**Why JOIN Us?**
We are an established medical device leader that is preparing for high growth. This means that PENTAX is looking to invest in its team and provide a collaborative and encouraging work environment. *This role is ideal for someone looking to gain HR experience in a wide range of HR function with emphasis on talent acquisition.*
**PENTAX Medical is proud of its comprehensive benefits program and generous Paid Time Off and Holiday policy.**
**Want More INFO?**
**Summary**
The HR Coordinator provides day to day support in executing various programs covering a broad range of HR issues which may include recruitment, system maintenance, reporting, and benefits, supporting the PENTAX Americas region (Canada through Latin America).
**Responsibilities of the HR & Recruiting Coordinator:**
* Support recruitment by managing the job postings, screening resumes, completing the preliminary interviews, scheduling formal interviews, and sharing feedback with hiring manager and/or agencies. Ensure all branding guidelines and recruitment processes are followed for both Canada and US positions.
* Administer benefits for all US employees included medical, dental, vision, life insurance, indemnity plans, FSA, and other benefits and company provided perks. This includes connecting directly with benefits broker or the carriers directly.
* Maintain Open Job Report and track internal staffing requisitions, recruiting metrics, including time to fill and cost per hire.

* Manage and maintain applicant tracking system

* Onboard employees into HR systems, including payroll (ADP), awards systems, talent management (Oracle) and benefits for the US and Canada as applicable for each region
* Assist with maintaining integrity of information on ADP Workforce Now and Oracle and run reports if requested.
* Provide backup to orientation meetings. Onboard new employees including collection of paperwork, notification to appropriate personnel and maintain onboarding portal
* Maintain employee electronic personnel files, including I-9 files
* Manage PO process for the department
* Other duties as assigned


**Requirements of the Clinical Applications Specialist:**
* Bachelor’s degree; HR Certification or Master's Degree preferred
* 2+ years of HR relevant experience in a professional office environment
* Experience with recruiting strongly preferred
* Strong attention to detail, strong commitment to following documented processes and best practices
* Strong sense of urgency

**It is the ongoing policy and practice of PENTAX Medical to provide equal opportunity in employment to all employees and applicants. title: Director, Development
description:
**About Us**

Solar Landscape is the leading commercial and community solar developer in the United States.

We partner with the world's largest real estate companies to develop, install, and operate solar projects on commercial and industrial rooftops. Through our groundbreaking community solar model, households in surrounding communities can subscribe to receive solar power at a guaranteed discount.

To date, Solar Landscape has deployed over 500 megawatts of renewable energy projects totaling over $1 billion in capital investment. Solar Landscape was named the #1 Distributed Generation developer for 2023 by New Project Media and was awarded the U.S. Department of Energy’s Equitable Community Solar Grand Prize.  

We reinvest in our communities as a leading provider of solar PPAs to municipalities, schools, and universities, as well as through our award-winning solar workforce development program.  

Solar Landscape is growing fast. Doubling in size year after year, we are looking for the best and brightest to drive our next phase of growth. We’re made up of thought leaders, thinkers, dreamers, doers. We are insightful, driven, rebellious, fun, and we are better together. Our diverse and unique backgrounds are all given a voice and seat at the table to help make real change for the communities we serve.

For more about Solar Landscape, visit www.solarlandscape.com.
**About The Role**  

The Director of Development is responsible for leading and managing the company's efforts to cultivate and expand relationships with key clients. This role requires a self-starter and strategic thinker with deep experience in managing client relationships, excellent verbal / written communication, and strong leadership skills. The Director will be responsible for driving revenue growth, ensuring customer satisfaction and strategically partnering with our clients to execute their solar strategies. This role will be supported by a team of Development Analysts who will aid in client execution.
### **Responsibilities**

* **Strategic Account Management:** Develop and maintain relationships with C-suite and key decision-makers at large commercial and industrial companies. Understand clients' solar needs and provide tailored solar solutions to meet those needs. Lead and close lease negotiations and ensure project delivery once the project is won.
* **Business Development:** Help develop a comprehensive solar strategy for our key clients. Expand our coverage of our clients’ asset portfolio by bringing our relationship to new markets. Collaborate with Policy, Sales Analytics/ Enablement and Marketing teams to align client approach to our company strategy
* **Customer Engagement:** Prepare proposals and presentations of partnership opportunities with Solar Landscape. Provide exceptional customer service and support throughout the sales process. Address customer inquiries, concerns, and feedback in a timely and professional manner.
* **Market Monitoring:** Collaborate with in-house Policy and Sales Analytics/ Enablement teams to stay informed about policy changes, industry trends, market conditions, and competitor activities.

### **Required Qualifications**

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in sales, business development, account management, project development or management consulting
* Leadership ability and comfortable driving high-visibility projects
* Excellent organization and communication skills
* Detail-oriented, self-starter
* Experience managing client relationships at large companies
* Knowledge of sustainability related topics including Solar Energy and ESG topics and trends
* Well-versed in MS Office suite
* 10-20% travel required; must be willing to travel to Asbury Park office and to clients, as needed. This role is flexible on home location.

### **Preferred Qualifications**

* 2+ years of experience in the solar energy industry
* Familiarity with Microsoft Dynamics or other CRM
* Strong understanding of rooftop commercial PV construction means and methods, behind-the-meter and Utility interconnections, and Power Purchase Agreements and EPC Contracts.
* Technical understanding of the Commercial & Industrial solar development process, including utility interconnection, AHJ permitting, and construction

**Benefits and Perks**

Solar Landscape’s company culture is second to none.
Our employees combine our mission, grit and drive with a rebel’s attitude that is changing the industry:* Located in the heart of historic Asbury Park, our state-of-the-art office space offers flexible workstations encouraging collaboration and movement.
* Employees come together to eat every day! Like in a home, our gourmet kitchen is the heart of the office. Solar Landscape has a full-time in-house chef cooking daily farm-to-table meals using locally sourced organic food.
* Also included in employees is our competitive compensation package; a 401(k) employer-match; health, dental, & vision insurance, flexible paid time off and holiday PTO; We provide healthy snacks, coffee, volunteer opportunities, company outings, and more!

description:
